result.execSummary:
The defendant Tavone E Newell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tavone E Newell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tavone E Newell was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Tavone E Newell was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Tavone E Newell was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Emailed copy of the minutes to DOC.
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant Tavone E Newell in court.  Attorney Nancy L. Moore in court for Tavone E Newell.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Rob Csencsics from DCPS in court. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 5, 6, 10.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8, 9, 11. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #  5  
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 180 days To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2). 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1185 and cc to count 6 and 10


-Stayed for 2 years probation cc 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1185 and cc to count 6 and 10

COUNT #  6    
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 180 days To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2). 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1185 and cc to count 5 and 10


-Stayed for 2 years probation cc 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1185 and cc to count 5 and 10


IMPOSED AND STAYED

COUNT # 10 
-serve 42 month  in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 18 months 
-extended supervision: 24 months

-cc to: 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1185 and cc to count 5 and 6

Stayed for 4 years probation cc 19CM3065, 21CF2009, 22CF1185 and cc to count 5 and 6

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

CONDITIONS:

-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 5, 6, 10

-All CC, DNA surcharge due on probation


-Bond posted to be returned to poster.

-Days credit if revoked: 55 days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jo W]

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). $1,000 previously posted. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MMW while in custody at the Dane County Jail.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KS while in custody at the Dane County Jail.
- Defendant shall not be on Winnebago St in Madison.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
